cx.corp.lacuna.core

Interface MemoryWriter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MemoryWriterImpl

    public interface MemoryWriter
    Provides methods for writing bytes and common Java data types to the memory of a native process.
    See Also:
    NativeProcessEnumerator, MemoryReader

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void write(NativeProcess process, int offset, byte[] values)
      Writes an array of bytes to the specified offset.
      void writeBoolean(NativeProcess process, int offset, boolean value)
      Writes an 8-bit boolean value to the specified offset.
      void writeByte(NativeProcess process, int offset, byte value)
      Writes a byte to the specified offset.
      void writeCharUTF16LE(NativeProcess process, int offset, char value)
      Writes one 16-bit UTF-16 little endian code unit to the specified offset.
      void writeCharUTF8(NativeProcess process, int offset, char value)
      Writes one 8-bit UTF-8 code unit to the specified offset.
      void writeDouble(NativeProcess process, int offset, double value)
      Writes an 64-bit IEEE 754 double precision floating point value to the specified offset.
      void writeFloat(NativeProcess process, int offset, float value)
      Writes an 32-bit IEEE 754 single precision floating point value to the specified offset.

      Writes a little-endian 32-bit integer to the specified offset.

      Writes a little-endian 64-bit integer to the specified offset.
      void writeShort(NativeProcess process, int offset, short value)
      Writes a little-endian 16-bit short integer to the specified offset.

      Writes an UTF-16 little-endian encoded string to the specified offset.
      void writeStringUTF8(NativeProcess process, int offset, java.lang.String value)
      Writes an UTF-8 encoded string to the specified offset.

    • Method Detail

      • writeBoolean

        void writeBoolean(NativeProcess process,
                  int offset,
                  boolean value)
           throws MemoryAccessException
        Writes an 8-bit boolean value to the specified offset. True will be written as a 1, and false as a 0.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - THe value to write to memory. True will write 1, false will write 0.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.

      • writeByte

        void writeByte(NativeProcess process,
               int offset,
               byte value)
        throws MemoryAccessException
        Writes a byte to the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - The value to write to memory.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.

      • writeCharUTF8

        void writeCharUTF8(NativeProcess process,
                   int offset,
                   char value)
            throws MemoryAccessException
        Writes one 8-bit UTF-8 code unit to the specified offset.

        Notice that this method only writes one byte, so characters which are encoded into multiple bytes are not supported. If attempting to write characters higher than U+007F, this method will throw an exception. To write multi-byte characters, use writeStringUTF8(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, java.lang.String).

        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - The value to write to memory.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the character is encoded into multiple bytes.
        See Also:
        writeCharUTF16LE(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, char), writeStringUTF8(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, java.lang.String), writeStringUTF16LE(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, java.lang.String)

      • writeCharUTF16LE

        void writeCharUTF16LE(NativeProcess process,
                      int offset,
                      char value)
               throws MemoryAccessException
        Writes one 16-bit UTF-16 little endian code unit to the specified offset.

        Notice that this method only writes one 16-bit code unit, so characters which are encoded with two surrogate units are not supported. If attempting to write characters higher than U+FFFFF, this method will throw an exception. To write multiple code units, use writeStringUTF16LE(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, java.lang.String)

        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - The value to write to memory.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the character is encoded into multiple bytes.
        See Also:
        writeCharUTF8(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, char), writeStringUTF16LE(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, java.lang.String), writeStringUTF8(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, java.lang.String)

      • writeShort

        void writeShort(NativeProcess process,
                int offset,
                short value)
         throws MemoryAccessException
        Writes a little-endian 16-bit short integer to the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - The value to write to memory.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        This method uses little-endian byte order to represent multi-byte values.

        This method uses little-endian byte order to represent multi-byte values.

        Throws:

        void writeDouble(NativeProcess process,
                 int offset,
                 double value)
          throws MemoryAccessException
        Writes an 64-bit IEEE 754 double precision floating point value to the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - The value to write to memory.

        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        This method uses little-endian byte order to represent multi-byte values.

      • writeStringUTF8

        void writeStringUTF8(NativeProcess process,
                     int offset,
                     java.lang.String value)
              throws MemoryAccessException
        Writes an UTF-8 encoded string to the specified offset.

        Notice that UTF-8 is a variable length character encoding, in which Unicode code points higher than U+007F are encoded with two to four 8-bit code units. Users should be careful when writing characters which use multiple code units, as String.length() returns the amount of UTF-16 code units. Use String.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8) to retrieve the amount of bytes written by this method.

        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - The value to write to memory.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process or value is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value is empty.

      • writeStringUTF16LE

        void writeStringUTF16LE(NativeProcess process,
                        int offset,
                        java.lang.String value)
                 throws MemoryAccessException
        Writes an UTF-16 little-endian encoded string to the specified offset.

        Notice that UTF-16 is a variable length character encoding, in which Unicode code points higher than U+FFFF are encoded with two 16-bit surrogate code units. Users should be careful when writing characters which use multiple code units, as String.length() returns the amount of 16-bit UTF-16 code units. Use String.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_16LE) to retrieve the amount of bytes written by this method.

        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - The value to write to memory.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process or value is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value is empty.

      • write

        void write(NativeProcess process,
           int offset,
           byte[] values)
    throws MemoryAccessException
        Writes an array of bytes to the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        values - The value to write to memory.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process or values is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if values is empty.
